13   |  **   Description:	Lists the currently loaded modulefiles.		     **
14   |  ** 									     **
15   |  **   Exports:		ModuleCmd_List					     **

60   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
61   |

63   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/

68   | 
69   | /*++++
70   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
71   |  ** 									     **
72   |  **   Function:		ModuleCmd_List					     **
73   |  ** 									     **
74   |  **   Description:	Execution of the module-command 'list'		     **
75   |  **			Lists all modules stored in the environment variable **
76   |  **			'LOADEDMODULES'					     **
77   |  ** 									     **
78   |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
79   |  ** 									     **
80   |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Attached Tcl Interp. **
81   |  **			int		 argc		Number of args	     **
82   |  **			char 		*argv[]		Argument list	     **
83   |  ** 									     **
84   |  **   Result:		int	TCL_ERROR	Failure			     **
85   |  **				TCL_OK		Successful operation	     **
86   |  ** 									     **
87   |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
88   |  ** 									     **
89   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
90   |  ++++*/
91   | 
92   | int	ModuleCmd_List(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
93   | 			int		 argc,
94   |                    	char		*argv[])
95   | {
96   |     /**
97   |      **  Get the list of loaded modules at first
98   |      **/
99   | 
100  |     char	*loaded, *lmfiles;
101  |     int		 i, count1, count2;
102  |     char	*list[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
103  |     char	*files[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
104  |     char	*tmplist[ MOD_BUFSIZE], *s;
105  |     int	  	 len;
106  | 
107  |     lmfiles = getLMFILES( interp);
108  |     loaded = getenv( "LOADEDMODULES");
109  |     
110  |     if( !loaded || !*loaded) {
111  | 	if( sw_format & (SW_TERSE | SW_LONG | SW_HUMAN) )
112  | 	    fprintf(stderr, "%s\n",
113  | 		_("No Modulefiles Currently Loaded."));
114  |     } else {
115  | 
116  | 	/**
117  | 	 **  Now tokenize it, form a list and print it out.
118  | 	 **/
119  | 
120  | 	if( sw_format & SW_LONG ) {
121  | 	    fprintf( stderr,"%s", _(long_header));
122  | 	}
123  | 	if( sw_format & (SW_TERSE | SW_LONG | SW_HUMAN) )
124  | 	    fprintf( stderr, "%s\n",
125  | 		_("Currently Loaded Modulefiles:"));
126  | 
127  | 	/**
128  | 	 **  LOADEDMODULES and _LMFILES_ should provide a list of loaded
129  | 	 **  modules and assigned files in the SAME ORDER
130  | 	 ** but double check, because if they aren't you will get a crash.
131  | 	 **/
132  | 
133  | 	count1 = 1;
134  |         for( list[ 0] = xstrtok( loaded, ":");
135  | 	    (list[ count1] = xstrtok( NULL, ":"));
136  | 	     count1++ );
137  | 
138  | 	count2 = 1;
139  |         for( files[ 0] = xstrtok( lmfiles, ":");
140  | 	    (files[ count2] = xstrtok( NULL, ":"));
141  | 	     count2++ );
142  | 	if (count1 != count2) {
143  | 	  ErrorLogger( ERR_ENVVAR, LOC, NULL);
144  | 	}
145  | 	  
146  | 
147  | 	/**
148  | 	 **  We have to build a single list of files for each loaded entry
149  | 	 **  in order to be able to figure out the length of the directory
150  | 	 **  part
151  | 	 **/
152  | 
153  | 	for( i=0; i<count1; i++) {
154  | 
155  | 	    len = strlen( files[i]) - strlen( list[i]);
156  | 	    tmplist[i] = files[i];
157  | 
158  | 	    /**
159  | 	     **  We have to source all relevant .modulerc and .version files
160  | 	     **  on the path
161  | 	     **/
162  | 
163  | 	    s = files[i] + len;
164  | 	    while( s) {
165  | 		if( (s = strchr( s, '/')) )
166  | 		    *s = '\0';
167  | 
168  | 		SourceRC( interp, files[i], modulerc_file);
169  | 		SourceVers( interp, files[i], list[i]);
170  | 
171  | 		if( s)
172  | 		    *s++ = '/';
173  | 	    }
174  | 
175  | 	    /** 
176  | 	     **  Print this guy
177  | 	     **/
178  | 	}
179  | 	print_aligned_files( interp, NULL, NULL, tmplist, count1, 1);
180  |     }
181  | 
182  |     /**
183  |      **  Return on success
184  |      **/
185  | 
186  |     return( TCL_OK);
187  | 
188  | } /** End of 'ModuleCmd_List' **/
